TURN THIS COURTROOM INTO A CIRCUS

TOOTY FRUITY CONTINUES AS DAVID FLIPS FRANTICALLY THROUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A college counselor stands at the Podium lecturing the hi school seniors about their future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... For those of you going on to college next year, the chance of finding a good job will actually decrease by the time you graduate. Entry level jobs will drop from thirty-one to twenty-six percent, and the median income for those jobs will go down as well ... There is some rustling in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, my friends, it's a competitive world and good grades are your only ticket through. By the year Two Thousand  ... INT. HIGH SCHOOL. HEALTH CLASS. A different teacher lectures a different class of student

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The chance of contracting HIV from a promiscuous lifestyle will climb to one in one hundred and fifty. The odds of dying in an auto accident are only one in twenty-five hundred. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this marks a drastic increase ... INT. HIGH SCHOOL. SCIENCE CLASS. Same angle. Different teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... From just four years ago when ozone depletion was at ten percent of its current level. By the time you are twenty years old, average global temperature will have risen two and a half degrees. Even a shift of one degree can cause such catastrophic consequences as typhoons, floods, widespread drought and famine. REVERSE ANGLE. STUDENTS. They stare back in stunned silence. One of them, DAVID WAGNER, sits in the front row with a pencil in his mouth. Nobody moves ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chipper classroom tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Who can tell me what famine is?

Birds are chirping. The sun is shining. All the hedges ar neatly pruned and the lawns are perfectly manicured. A sw stillness hangs over the SUBURBAN STREET, which is bathed beautiful BLACK AND WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm home. SUBURBAN HOME. GEORGE PARKER enters the front door and hangs his hat on coatrack. He sets his briefcase down and moves into the f with a huge smile on his face. It's a frozen smile that doesn't seem to be affected by too much in particular--li tour guide at Disneyland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello darling. WIDER. MRS. GEORGE PARKER (BETTY) enters, untying the back of he apron. She is a vision of '50s beauty with a thin figure concrete hair. Betty crosses to her husband and hands him fresh martini. She kisses him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, swell. You know, Mr. Connel said that if things keep going the way they are, I might be seeing that promotion sooner than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh darling that's wonderful! (an adoring gaze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew you could do it. WAGNER LIVING ROOM. NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: --, (LIVING COLOR)
dialogues.text: DAVID WAGNER sits on his couch watching this entire actio a sleek new Sony T.V. He stares riveted at the set with a smile on his face. David wears black shoes, black pants, black t-shirt and a black baseball cap, not a nerd exactl ... He reaches next to him into a huge bag of Doritos, ne taking his eyes off the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Pumpkin! What's that smell? (sniffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your meat loaf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (by rote)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It might be ..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shy smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be. He leans over and kisses her--again on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Pumpkin! You sure know the way to this man's heart. There is a loud and inappropriate LAUGH TRACK. David smil wider and is just about to reach for more corn chips, whe his real MOTHER'S VOICE rings out from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Bullshit Barry, that wasn't the deal INT. KITCHEN. David's mom paces the room with the phone in her hand. Between the plastic surgery and the make-up it's hard to her age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--you have custody the first weekend of every month and this is the first weekend ... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if yesterday was the thirtieth, this is still the first weekend. INT. LIVING ROOM. Her words drift in from the kitchen while David stares at show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I can't bail you out, I'm supposed to go to La Costa ... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if I want to get a mud bath, that's really my business, isn't it? He reaches out and TURNS UP THE SOUND. PLEASANTVILLE play an unnaturally high volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Where are those kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reciting--a little louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Right behind you father."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right behind you father.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME T.V., (BLACK AND WHITE)
dialogues.text: The Parkers' son and daughter (BUD AND MARY SUE) enter th foyer together. Mary Sue wears her hair in a pony tail. B has on a Letterman's sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother ... Father ... Bud has a little surprise for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that Bud? Bud hesitates for a moment, then folds up a shiny blue ribbon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First prize at the science fair. There were lots of swell projects--guess mine was just the "swellest".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling that's wonderful. Except there's no such word as "swellest".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well gee whizz, Mom. lt wasn't the "English" fair. There is another jarring LAUGH TRACK. CLOSE UP. DAVID. He smiles right along with it. David stares transfixed at set despite the continuing conversation in the other room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well sure they can stay by themselves, Barry, but that's not the point. You said you'd take them. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well fine--they'll stay by themselves then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a mother to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh--what's a mother to do? CLOSE UP. DAVID. He grabs another handful of Doritos staring at the T.V ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cacophony of modem life. Beepers and nose rings--blue h and tattoos. Dissonant boom boxes compete with one anothe The hormones are running crazy. SCHOOL COURTYARD. lt is a large open area, alive at lunchtime. Groups of ki hang out together, divided by their various cliques. The music pounds in the background. CLOSE UP. DAVID. He stands at one end of the courtyard beside a chain link fence. Beads of sweat form on David's forehead as he spea to someone in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I mean ... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hi. REVERSE ANGLE. A very pretty blonde girl smiles back at him. It's a warm welcoming smile. CLOSE UP. DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. You probably don't think I should be asking you this. I mean--not knowing you well and all ... REVERSE ANGLE. GIRL. She smiles wider at him, inviting him to continue. CLOSE UP. DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause ...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I know you--everybody knows you ... I just don't know you ... technically. REVERSE ANGLE. GIRL. She nods at him ... CLOSE UP. DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well--I was just wondering--'cause I see you all the time in Algebra and I heard you humming that Van Halen song and I really like that song too ... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyhow, I don't know what you're doing this weekend but my Mom's leaving town and she said I could use her car so ... REVERSE ANGLE. GIRL. She positively beams. The girl flicks her blonde hair and stares back at him adoringly. CLOSE UP. DAVID. Instead of smiling back, David just stares, then looks at ground. WIDE ANGLE. SCHOOLYARD. For the first time WE SEE THAT SHE WASN'T TALKING TO HIM. David stands a good hundred yards across the schoolyard, rehearsing this speech while the young woman stands face face with a much cooler boy. He has a cell phone and a ve hip haircut. ANGLE. DAVID. David watches as the girl throws her arm around the boy's waist and heads out of the playground ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and his friends are all gathered around the plastic picnic tables and vending machines that form the luncheon court. The chess club meets at one end and there are some teachers at the other. All the cool kids are on the other side of the fence but David and his friends eat lunch at same table every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, whose window did Bud break when he was playing with his father's golf clubs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy. Mr. Jenkins. What JOB did Mr. Jenkins have? Howard looks at him, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salesman. What did Bud and Mary Sue name the cat they found in the gutter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marmalade. They all nod--and murmur with admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay--here's one: Why did their parents come home early from their weekend at the lake? Everybody thinks. Nobody knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause Bud didn't answer the phone and they were worried about him. It's quiet for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're unbelievable. You'll win this thing for sure. When is it on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marathon starts at 6:30. Contest's tomorrow at noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weighing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand dollars ... And it's on all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it is Howard. That's why they call it a Marathon.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER SIDE OF THE FENCE.
dialogues.text: David's sister, Jennifer, hangs out with her friends in t parking lot. All the girls are dressed in the exact same uniform: Blue jeans, beeper on the belt, white V-neck T shirt, car keys in their hand. (Even the girls WITHOUT a hold car keys in their hand). Jennifer is by far the prettiest and, thus, is the leader of the group. They all look toward the Luncheon Court where David and his friend are hanging out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod, it's so mortifying, being related to him. I can't believe you're like--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only on my parent's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but you're like ... twins and stuff. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be from like, the cool side of the uterus. A group of VERY HIP boys strut through the parking lot. T bop up and down with the self-confidence of all cool sixt year olds. The girls freeze when they see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod, omigod--here they come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do anything. Just don't like--do anything ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cooly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Mark. DIFFERENT ANGLE. He pauses then looks over at her. Jennifer slides sinuous off the fender of the car, flicking her hair like a young racehorse. She has a perfect 16 year old body and the who parking lot knows it. Mark heads over to her, followed by lackies. The two groups meet at the tail-gate of the Niss Pathfinder like a small summit conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jennifer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Beat ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jennifer's lackies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw you at the mall yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ... Saw you too. Everyone nods for a moment or two. No one says anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you watching Pearl Jam on MTV tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer pauses, weighing the next statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom'll be out of town. Kimmy and Christin positively GASP while Mark's Lackeys mumble and glance around. The import of the thing isn't l on anybody. Mark bobs up and down a little faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So uh ... Maybe we could uh ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding faster)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Everybody bobs and shuffles for В” beat, when Mark nods, summoning his flock.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. WAGNER HOUSE. DUSK.
dialogues.text: lt is a south-westem version of "Leave it to Beaver." The uniformity of Suburbia has been washed in earth tones. Th is a red tile roof gracing every home. All the houses hav the same anemic palm tree. It's a urban planner's version hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I know, I know--He's just like so FINE ... I'm still like: "Omigod." INT. WAGNER HOME. lt is just as sleek and impersonal as before. Maybe more at night. Jennifer crosses through the living room with t cordless phone attached to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was amazing, Daph ... I'm like: "Well my Mom'll be out of town." And he's like "Well then, maybe we could-- you know ..." And I'm like "Yeah, sure." And he's like "Well, cool." (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, he's just so smart. (pause ...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe that black thing I just got. (pause ...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not slutty, Daph, it's cute. (pause ... )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, "hello?" He's not coming  over here to study ... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Well I'm jealous of you too sometimes. INT. DAVID'S BEDROOM. lt is studious and academic--not joyless, but not colorfu either. David stands at his bedroom window, staring outsi with a cordless phone in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He's not homeless Howard, they just don't say where he lives. (pause ...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's a silly question. (pause ...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because nobody's homeless in Pleasantville. REVERSE ANGLE. HIS POV. His mother loads the final Louis Vuitton bag into her Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... because that's just not what it's like. She fires up the car and pulls out of the driveway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Howard--it's almost six-thirty. I gotta go. INT. WAGNER LIVING ROOM. The huge black TV sits like a monolith in the middle of t room. All at once David comes bounding down the stairs ma a B-Iine for the couch. Jennifer enters just as quickly f the other direction, fiddling with her clothes. DIFFERENT ANGLE. They hit the coffee table and reach for the remote contro exactly the same moment. Both of them freeze then look up each other in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Neither one moves. They clutch the remote together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, cut it out. Mark Davis is gonna like be here in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well great. The Pleasantville Marathon starts at six thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasantville Marathon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost reverently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Every episode ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting hysterical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod, I don't be-lieeeeve this! He's gonna like beeeee here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weil great. You can watch TV upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs! Up-staiiirs! There isn't any

dialogues.speaker: STEREO
dialogues.text: Jennifer gets panicked and yanks at the remote. David yan back and before they know it, the remote goes flying out their hands, CRASHING onto the hardwood floor. lt smashes into a million tiny pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God ... (sinking to his knees/ scooping up the remains)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, stop stressing, you can like-- turn it on normally ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you can't, Jen! It's a new TV. It doesn't work without a remote. David cradles the pieces like a fallen comrade, when the DOORBELL RINGS behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! He's here! Jennifer sweeps some of the pieces frantically under the and tries to adjust her outfit on the way to the door. Da just stares in shock at the shattered plastic. Jennifer reaches the front door and wets her lips. She fluffs her quickly, sticks out her chest then swings it open. DIFFERENT ANGLE. FRONT DOOR. Jennifer steps forward with her sexiest smile, but it isn Mark Davis on the other side. DICK VAN DYKE STANDS ACROSS THRESHOLD IN A TV REPAIRMAN'S OUTFIT. Jennifer looks at h puzzled. He steps forward, flashing her a chipper grin, toolbox in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV repair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV repair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. TV busted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause ...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling wider)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well here I am. REVERSE ANGLE. DAVID'S POV. He glances out the front door toward a weird VAN parked a the curb. It says TV REPAIR on the side but looks like something from a medicine show. The antenna on top resemb a weather vane and the mural beneath it depicts a happy family from the 1950s, gathered around their TV set. Ever wears a smile, including the dog. The hand-painted motto reads "Rob's TV Repair--WE'LL FIX YOU FOR GOOD." INT. LIVING ROOM. David looks back at Dick Van Dyke who smiles at him, then crosses to the living room STEPPING NIMBLY AROUND THE OTTOMAN. He heads toward the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing the smashed remote)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy cow. Look at that. Had a little disaster didn't ya fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ... Sort of ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (setting down the toolbox)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get you fixed up in no time. He pops the top of the tool box while Jennifer and David stare. It's a strange looking box with the same happy fam painted on the side. Dick Van Dyke pulls out another remo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how I'd feel if mine went out. Almost like losing a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentatively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, we didn't call any TV repair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that makes it a lucky day for both of us, hunh? Jennifer shuts the door and crosses down toward the livin room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you could do this like soon? It's almost six thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the rush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pleasantville Marathon starts at six thirty. At that moment there is a huge FORK OF LIGHTNING and a booming CLAP OF THUNDER. It literally rattles the walls o the house as Dick Van Dyke turns toward David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasantville? David recoils slightly. Dick Van Dyke flashes him a smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, I loved that show. Watched it for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the reason. I've got a date at six thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring her/ leaning closer to David)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--who did Muff in take to the masquerade ball when her date came down with the measles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. And how did she dress him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still staring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Like Prince Charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying David/ nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice ... Nice ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um--hello? I've got like a social emergency here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the one where Bud lost his cousin when he was s'posed to be watching him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What department store did they go to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McIntire's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McGinty's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. McIntire's. Remember: (sings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "For the very best in men's attire, Head right down to McIntire's."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. He stares at David, speechless, for a moment, then smiles fondly and reaches beside him for his tool kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say--why don't you take this remote instead. It's got a little more "Ooomph" in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooomph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Big beautiful set like this--you want something that'll put you right in the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take it. CLOSER. He flashes them a big smile and holds out a weird looking contraption that seems more primitive than space age. It' strange combination of an early transistor radio and Flas Gordon ray gun. Dick Van Dyke extends it with pride, whil Jennifer and David stare at him warily ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much does it cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh--couldn't charge you for something like that. It's free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure. Big fan like yourself. It's the least I could do. There is a SECOND CLAP OF THUNDER even louder than the fi The house rattles for a moment then is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I better get going. Your show's almost on, and ... (smiling at Jennifer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost time for your date. He places the remote control gingerly on the coffee table smiles at them. Dick starts across the living room when h suddenly catches his foot on the leg of the ottoman and tumbles end over end. He rolls on the carpet, executes a perfect somersault and comes right back to a standing position. David and Jennifer stare at him stunned when he looks back at them and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care now. There is another flash of lightning as he reaches for the doorknob. David and Jennifer look at one another while th front door shuts with a THUD. It's quiet for a second or before there is another CLAP OF THUNDER. David cocks his head. DIFFERENT ANGLE. David glances down at the strange contraption sitting on coffee table. It looks a little scary. Slowly, very slowy reaches down and touches it. Nothing seems to happen so h picks it up. CLOSER. David points the remote toward the TV set with an apprehensive look on his face. He winces a little, then pushes one of the buttons. DIFFERENT ANGLE. The TV set turns on. Oprah's face fills the screen as an angry housewife screams at a transvestite!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunh. It ail seems normal as he pushes another button. This tim the channel changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relaxing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. He continues to press the button, flipping through the channels. Jennifer sees that everything is fine and reach for the remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. He continues to flip through the channels, coming to rest the Pleasantville Marathon. BUD'S VOICE fills the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee whizz, Mary Sue--why can't I borrow your transistor radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised Betty Jane she could use it over the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud and Mary Sue clutch either end of a small transistor radio. They seem to be in the EXACT SAME POSITION as Davi and Jennifer, who are struggling over the remote control. ANGLE. DAVID AND JENNIFER. She tugs the remote while David yanks in the other direct

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind. This is like the most important moment of my whole life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it Jen, I've waited a year for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "But I told Mr. Miller I'd bring a transistor in to electric shop."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And I told Betty Jean she could have it for the picnic with Roy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yanking at it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, David. Just give it to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yanking it back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU get lost! WIDER. LIVING ROOM. She tugs at the remote trying to wrestle it out of his ha David pulls in the opposite direction as they POINT IT DIRECTLY TOWARD THE TV. DIFFERENT ANGLE. SPECIAL EFFECT. A huge white light emanates from the contraption, like th own atomic blast wave. The entire room is filled with a BLINDING AURA for a second or two, before it actually get sucked into the TV. WIDE ANGLE. LIVING ROOM. It is suddenly empty--illuminated only by the soft glow o the picture tube. David and Jennifer are nowhere in sight INT. PARKER LIVING ROOM. (PLEASANTVILLE) DAY. David and Jennifer are standing in the middle of the 1950 living room, dressed in Bud and Mary Sue's clothing. They still clutch the remote control in the exact same positio that was occupied by their fictional counterparts. David Jennifer glance at one another, then look horrified aroun the room. THE WORLD HAS TURNED TO BLACK AND WHITE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Parker (Bud and Mary Sue's father) enters from the landing whistling a happy tune. He's dressed in a gray su with a gray shirt, and a dark gray tie with little gray d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if to his own children)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Sport, hi Muffin ... Better get a move on, you're gonna be late for school. He continues to cross through the living room whistling i the kitchen ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining her black and white skin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uchh! Look at me?! I'm like so ... pasty! He glances down at the remote control that sits lifeless his hand. David frantically presses the buttons but nothi happens. All at once, there is a voice behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psst! Over here. DIFFERENT ANGLE. They whirl around to see DICK VAN DYKE'S FACE smiling at from the TV set in the comer. It's an old '50s set with a round picture tube. They run over to him as he smiles. Hi face is the only color in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you it was your lucky day. Bet you thought I was just a fan or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A miracle. They stare stunned at the TV set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... See, every time I thought I'd found someone they'd turn out to disappoint me. They'd know the early episodes, but they wouldn't know the later ones ... They'd know all about Muffin but they wouldn't know about Bud ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the TV set)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh! Can't talk like that now. You're in ... (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know ... David glances around at his black and white surroundings. "mother's" voice rings out from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud. Mary Sue ... Breakfast is on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in Pleasantville?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dream come true, hunh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't funny! I happen to have a very important date in like five minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you don't have to worry about that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All at once the scene on the TV changes and Dick Van Dyke picture gives way to a WIDE ANGLE SHOT of the WAGNER HOUS Mark Davis is standing at the front door, BANGING on the brass knocker. He checks his watch, shifts restlessly for moment or two, then turns and heads down the flagstone wa never looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer flings herself at the screen, as Dick Van Dyke appears all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You--you gotta get us out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recoiling slightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we don't belong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure you do ... "McIntire's Department store" ... "Their father dressed as Prince Charming." That was gorgeous Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wailing on the floor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh GOD ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little snippy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know--this is a pretty strange way of showing your appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look--we appreciate it. We really do. We just--we want to go home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't know how long I've been looking for someone like you. A long face slowly descends on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very disappointed ... (deep breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact ... I'm starting to get a little upset. David moves toward the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weil wouldn't you! You look for someone for years ... You pour your heart into it ... This is a privilege you know. (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I better talk about this right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we should discuss this until I'm a little bit more composed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning his back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe in a day or so when I'm not so emotional ...

dialogues.speaker: COME BACK
dialogues.text: Dick Van Dyke shakes his head and walks out of the shot a the screen goes completely BLACK. It cuts out entirely as Jennifer and David just stare. David grabs the remote and starts rapidly pushing buttons. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dropping the gizmo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know ... It's not possible ... (looking at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bu-ud ... Mary Sue ... Your breakfast is getting cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be possible. DIFFERENT ANGLE. Betty (their "mother") sticks her head into the living ro wearing her black and white apron. She has a great big Pepsodent smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on kids. You're not going off to school without a hot breakfast inside you ... They just stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forward march. They exchange a strange little glance then slowly rise to their feet. Jennifer waits for David who forces a smile t starts toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just love you in that sweater Mary-Sue. It's so flattering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. INT. KITCHEN. David and Jennifer walk two steps into the kitchen when t suddenly freeze--agape at the spectacle in front of them: THEIR POV. PARKER KITCHEN. Every breakfast food imaginable has been laid upon the ta There are hotcakes and sausages and biscuits and eggs. Pitchers of orange juice are dwarfed by the mountains of The table literally sags under the weight of the food. Ge Parker lowers his morning paper and smiles at his childre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (once again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning kids. Better get a move on or you're going to be late for school. They nod, stunned, and wander forward into the room. Brig sunlight streams through the kitchen window as a gentle symphony of songbirds sings outside. David and Jennifer s straight ahead as their "mother" adds some waffles to the heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, c'mon. Dig in. David and Jennifer stare at her stunned as she puts two heaping plates at their places. Neither one moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jennifer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put blueberries in them just the way you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually--I'm not real ... hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh nonsense young lady. You're going to start your day with a nice big breakfast. She takes Jennifer by the shoulders and "guides" her into chair. Jennifer looks down at a huge plate of GRAY WAFFLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (oppressively chipper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Why don't you have some waffle cakes. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's sausage and eggs and some good crisp bacon ... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And a ham steak. Betty drenches the waffles in syrup and slathers on a hug slab of butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And of course, a nice big bowl of oatmeal. Jennifer hesitates then glances over at her "mother" who looks at her expectantly. She glances at David who just l stunned. Jennifer pauses then reaches down and takes a forkful of the oozing mess ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands facing the CAMERA in an actual Kinescope from 1 The backdrop is a painted pastoral landscape and the background singers are all white debutantes. He wears a letterman's sweater and button down shirt ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... Tooty fruity--oh rooty. Tooty Fruity ... Oh rooty." He CONTINUES his homogenized version of Little Richard's nasty hit, (all the nastiness gone). It becomes a slow an lilting melody ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... Tooty fruity--oh rooty ..." SERIES OF SHOTS. PLEASANTVILLE. The MUSIC CONTINUES as the CAMERA CUTS TO image after ima of this strange "Utopia." The effect is a weird, sanitizi version of MTV--as if Ronald Reagan had shot a music vide There are men tipping their hats and women walking their dogs; cheery gas station attendants and smiling policemen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly ...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... A wap bop a loo bop--a wap barn boom." Pruned hedges. Twin beds. BIG houses. The CAMERA CRANES D in the middle of a beautiful tree lined street to find Da and Jennifer walking up the sidewalk, holding their stoma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna hurl, David. I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take deep breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that animal fat. I feel it in my pores or something. Jennifer clutches her stomach, but David's glance darts f side to side--totally absorbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't see why we're doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're supposed to be in school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're supposed to be at home David! We're supposed to be in color! (wailing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God ... A man calls out from across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Mr. Simpson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear your Dad got a new car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. A Buick. It's swell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owns the hardware store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now you listen to me! I don't know what's going on but you'd better fix it! I had a date with Mark Davis and I even bought new UNDERWEAR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just gotta play along for a little while ... till that guy shows up again. Then I'll talk to him and ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah. I'm ... Bud Parker and you're ... um--Mary Sue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ripping the barette from her hair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'm not gonna do it! If I don't dress like this for Mom I'm sure as hell not going to do it for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a choice Jen. We're stuck until he comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't we just EXPLAIN IT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To who? Jen looks around this cheery little street, and the horro starts to dawn on her. At that moment, they hear a scream SIREN and a bright GRAY FIRE ENGINE comes racing up the block. WIDER. Jennifer and David step back on the curb as the firemen c flying out of the truck, grabbing the ladder on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They work in perfect precision. Two firemen grab the base the ladder while a third takes the front. They go tearing across one of the lawns, in full "emergency response" anchoring the ladder into the ground and winging it up in tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere, kitty ... He emerges a moment later with the cat who was stuck in t tree. Jennifer sinks to the curb as he carries the kitten them, petting it gently as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, we are. We're stuck in like "Nerdville". (shakes her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew you'd pay a price for this. I knew you couldn't be hopelessly geekridden for this long without suffering some like, really tragic consequences. (voice wavering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But it's just not fair. I mean--I'm starting to get really--popular. Debbi Russell transferred to another school and my skin's been great since March and Mark Davis is starting to come around and ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Mary Sue. Jennifer turns to see a strapping blonde seventeen year o driving by in his convertible. He is extremely handsome w Jack Armstrong features and a Letterman's sweater. Despit her crisis, Jennifer's jaw drops open as he slows to a cr Biff Martin flashes a huge Pepsodent smile. The guy is a "dreamboat".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all the commotion? Where's the cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um ... It's ... Biff turns to see the fireman climb into the truck, with kitty in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, right ... (smiling at her again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well--guess I'll see ya later Mary Sue. He takes off down the street with the sun glinting on his really keen convertible. Jennifer gapes as he disappears around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biff Martin. Captain of the basketball team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still gaping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he--you know--like "me"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flicking her hair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Streams of impeccably kept youngsters file through the do doors. All cheery and very pleasant looking. It looks lik Leni Riefenstahl movie. ANGLE. FROM ACROSS THE STREET. David stands beside Jennifer looking at the entrance to t school. Three girls huddle together by the front steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peggy Jane, Lisa Anne and Betty Jean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we do any better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Sue. You're gonna be late for Geography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay ... She flicks her hair back--cops a first day of school attitude, and heads across the street like she owns the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a propaganda film from the Eisenhower Administration. The boys all wear crew cuts and short sle button down shirts. The girls all have lacy dresses butto to the neck. Everyone stares straight ahead at the blackboard. ANGLE. FRONT OF THE ROOM. TEACHER. Miss Peters stands in front of the class with a pointer i her hand. She indicates a diagram that spans the length o the blackboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week Class, we discussed the geography of Main Street. This week, we're going to be talking about Elm Street. Can anyone tell me one of the differences between Elm Street and Main Street? (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not as long? Jennifer looks stunned as several students nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Tommy. It's not as long. Also, it only has houses. So the geography of Main Street is different than the geography of Elm Street. ANGLE. JENNIFER. She glances around at several students who seem to be nod in agreement. All at once, she thrusts her hand into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Sue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's outside of Pleasantville? The teacher looks at her with a puzzled frozen smile on h face. She looks vaguely troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside of Pleasantville ... What's at the end of Main Street? The class lets out a knowing groan--as if to say "Oh. We it now. Boy what a stupid question." Miss Peters gives a but condescending look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mary Sue. You should know the answer to that. The end of Main Street is just the beginning again. Miss Peters gives a big grin as a series of heads nod up down. Jennifer stares straight ahead, dumbfounded ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are fifteen to twenty boys scattered around the Gym Each is dressed identically in white shorts and black soc with a "PLEASANTVILLE" jersey. SHOT. DAVID. He stands at the free throw line with a basketball in his hand. (Not exactly an athletic image.) David lets go of a jump shot that swishes effortlessly through the net. He l a little surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. He stares at the backboard slightly intrigued. David retrieves the ball and fires again, this time chucking it up blind. The ball sails through the hoop again, HITTING NOTHING BUT NET. FULL SHOT. OTHER SIDE OF THE GYM. Ten to twelve of his teammates fire simultaneously at the hoop. ALL OF THE SHOTS SAIL THROUGH THE HOOP, NONE EVEN NICKING THE RIM. The boys retrieve their shots as the coa claps his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it men. Keep it up. Big game tomorrow. ANGLE. DAVID. He gets the ball and turns his back on the basket complet David flings the ball wildly over his shoulder. It bounce off all the walls of the gym, then glides through the net smoothly as the others. He stares in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud ... WIDER. Biff Martin (the boy in the convertible) approaches from other side of the Gym. He is a classic All American Hero- somewhere between 4-H club member and a future astronaut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ya Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ya Biff. He fidgets nervously for a moment looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ... If I was to ask your sister ... What I mean is, if I was to go up to Mary Sue ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God! Are we in that episode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to ask her out tonight, right? And then you want to give her your school pin ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ... How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky guess. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Biff ... I don't think it's a real good time for that right now ... Biff's expression falls. He stands crushed in front of Da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I mean is ... Mary Sue's been a little "different" lately ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't go out with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. It's just that right now ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'd do if she wouldn't go out with me ... All at once, Biff takes the basketball he's been holding hurls it toward the hoop. The ball does a couple of revolutions of the rim, and then amazingly pops out. WIDE ANGLE. GYM. Play comes to a halt. ALL THE PLAYERS TURN AND STARE, DUMBSTRUCK AT THE SIGHT OF A MISSED SHOT. SHOT. DAVID. He retrieves the ball quickly then hurries back to Biff. David pulls him aside as play slowly resumes on the other side of the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sure we'll work something out. I'll talk to her or something. Biff looks at him, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honest. It'll be fine. Biff nods, a little confused, as David pats him on the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David stands off to the side with his sister, while class pours out around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One date, Jen--that's all I'm asking. If you don't go out with this guy we could throw their whole universe out of whack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too weird David. This place is giving me the creeps. Did you know all the books are blank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked in the library. They got covers with nothing inside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing in a library?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got lost. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh here ... look at this! She reaches into her purse and pulls out a book of matche Jennifer tries to light a Kleenex on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watch. You know why those guys just get cats out of trees? 'Cause nothing burns around here, that's why! They don't need any firemen ... Sure enough the tissue has become flame retardant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen, listen ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like--really need a cigarette, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting his arm around her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get us out of here. I really will. But if we don't play along we could alter their whole existence. We may never get home. She looks over at him, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think anybody's gonna, like, notice if I don't have a chocolate malt with this guy. At that moment, three of Mary Sue's "friends" come titter around the comer. They skitter up to her like a group of wind-up toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (high-pitched--rapid fire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't believe what we just heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biff Martin's going to ask you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's not all ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not all ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to give you his pin! They explode in a torrent of TITTERS all over again. Jenn looks over at David. EXT. PARKER HOUSE. DUSK. A lone streetlamp glows in the foreground. Jennifer's voi plays OS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure I'm supposed to wear this? INT. MARY SUE'S ROOM. Jennifer emerges from the closet in a mohair sweater and poodle skirt. Under the sweater she wears a 1950's "bulle bra" that turn her breasts into lethal weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking in the mirror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could like kill a guy with these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in your closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining her profile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've worn some kinky stuff before ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't notice anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't notice that kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen please ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He-llo? I've got like three pounds of underwire here ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go with the program--hunh? I'm late for work.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SODA SHOP. DUSK.
dialogues.text: The flashing neon ice cream cone looks good enough to dri Underneath it, the swirling script spells "SODA SHOP". Jo Mathis drifts out into the evening air ... CLOSER. David comes sprinting up to the screen door and pauses to his breath. He adjusts a little soda jerk's hat, then plu inside. INT. SODA SHOP. Mr. Johnson, the owner and proprietor is wiping down the counter. He is a "pleasant" looking man, in his early for wearing a white apron and black glasses. The strains of "MISTY" get louder as Bud lets the screen door slam behin him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry ... I had to help my folks and then I couldn't find my hat ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. He stops wiping for a moment, holding the towel in his ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know what to do. He stares at the rag a little troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well--I always wipe down the counter and then you set out the napkins and glasses and then I make the french fries ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't come so I kept on wiping. He looks down at the towel clearly disturbed. David pause for a moment then starts toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. He crosses to Mr. Johnson who has polished one section of counter right down to the wood. David takes the towel out his hand and folds it neatly in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if this ever happens again, you can make the fries even if I haven't put out the napkins yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. EXT. PARKER HOUSE. NIGHT. Biff's convertible rolls up to the curb with Pat Boone playing on the radio. He runs a comb through his short bl hair before grabbing the bouquet of flowers next to him a heading up the walk. Biff rings the doorbell and, a momen later, Jennifer's silhouette appears in the doorway ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Mary Sue ... EXT. SODA SHOP. NIGHT. The place is really hopping now. All the spots in the par lot are filled with vintage "jalopies" and several patron are streaming through the door. The SAME JOHNNY MATHIS SO is still PLAYING on the juke box, and the neon ice cream sign blinks against the sky. INT. SODA SHOP. David is trapped behind the counter, furiously working to keep up with the load. Several clean cut teenagers pepper with orders while he yanks at the pumps and spiggots. It' clear he isn't used to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frazzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peppermint shake, chocolate soda, two orders of fries and a split?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peppermint soda, two chocolate shakes, order of fries, and we'll split it. David nods quickly, wiping some sweat from his brow. He scoops some ice cream into the metal blender as Mr. Johns comes up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't any cheeseburgers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, usually I put out the burger and then you finish with the lettuce ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me! Mr. Johnson recoils slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the lettuce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you cooked the burgers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quieter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can just put on the lettuce, finish the burger and pretend it was me doing it all along. Mr. Johnson stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. It's fine. DIFFERENT ANGLE. SODA SHOP ENTRANCE. The screen door swings open and is held there by the end Letterman's sweater. A moment later, Jennifer sashays through, parading her new Jane Russell profile. Her "girlfriends" TITTER from the comer as Biff rushes up to table, and pulls out a chair. She sashays into it, brushi against him as she goes. ANGLE. DAVID. He stares motionless at the spectacle--concerned and apprehensive. David holds a hot fudge sundae under the so spiggot and jerks back on the lever blowing ice cream all over his chest. FULL SHOT. TABLE. Biff stares across the table at Jennifer with the wholeso devotion of a labrador retriever. He looks like a cross between Troy Donahue and a mannequin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (haltingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure am glad you said you'd come out with me tonight Mary Sue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (full blown "Mary Sue")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well "gee whizz" Biff. I sure am glad you asked me. He guffaws for a moment or two before speaking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I ever said this to you before, but, well ... I think you're just about the keenest girl in the whole school ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really Biff? The keenest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all sarcasm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh. I hardly know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you two? WIDER. He stands at their table holding a little white pad of pa and a pencil. Jennifer looks up at her brother and almost bursts out laughing. He wears his soda jerk hat at a jaun angle with large white apron tied around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I dunno Bud. Guess I'll have my usual cheeseburger and a cherry coke. More goony laughs. David turns to Jennifer who puts on th same dopey countenance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I dunno Bud. Guess I'll just have a salad and an Evian Water. He shoots her a dirty look. Jennifer just smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheeseburger it is. ANGLE. FOLLOWING DAVID. He glowers at her all the way back to the counter. David posts the order in the little carousel clip board, keepin eye on the table the entire time ... RESUME. TABLE. Biff gazes across the table at Jennifer with an adoring l on his face. His hands are properly folded in front of hi She's still trying to do her best "Mary Sue."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the whole time we were in civics together, I really wanted to sit next to you--but you were always sitting between Peggy Jane and Lisa Anne. There is some TITTERING behind her. Jennifer doesn't resp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And you always seemed so smart and everything. Like that report you did on "Our Town Hall." Gosh. I didn't know what I'd talk to you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sometimes talking's over-rated. Don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunh? (goony laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right ... He still doesn't understand. Biff GUFFAWS for a moment or then glances down at the table top. There is a momentary break in the Music as Johnny Mathis' "MISTY" starts up al over again. It's enough to make you shoot yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I know I haven't been steady with anybody, but I just don't want to rush it. You don't want to make a mistake with something that important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, gosh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, there's kids that are even holding hands already but I figure there's plenty of time for that kind of thing later on. Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you bet. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you excuse me for a sec? Jennifer gets up in a daze and heads toward the bathroom. ANGLE. DAVID. He freezes behind the counter and watches as his sister practically stumbles through the bathroom door. INT. BATHROOM. Of course there aren't any toilets. Jennifer gropes her w to the sink and leans against the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Chirist ... She turns and sits against the sink for a moment with a dumbstruck look on her face. Jennifer shakes her head for moment or two, when the door to the bathroom bursts open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Did he give it to you ... Did he give it to you ... I bet he gave it to her ... Did he give it to you?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straight ahead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he knows how. They TITTER away, even though they don't get it either. I sounds like an aviary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he's gonna take her to Lover's Lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he is. I bet he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he's even gonna hold her hand! They TITTER some more as Jennifer shakes her head. INT. SODA SHOP. David is standing beside their table as she retums from t bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chipper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple of cheeseburgers and two cherry cokes. (pointedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need anything, I'll be right over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mary Sue)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee whiz "Bud", what could we possibly need when we have each other? She flashes him a "sweet" smile then reaches out and TOUC BIFF'S HAND. Both boys jump slightly as Jennifer gives he brother a venomous grin then suddenly waves "bye bye." Da just stares at her panicked as he moves haltingly back to Soda fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (befuddled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyhow ... I really wanted to come over and sit next to you in civics but ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna get out of here? You wanna leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But where would we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Lover's Lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lover's Lane! There is an audible GASP from the booth behind them. Jenn ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Lover's Lane. You up for it? CLOSE UP. BIFF. He just stares at her with his mouth open ... WIDER. Jennifer reaches forward grabbing his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let's go. FULL SHOT. SODA FOUNTAIN. David is in the middle of making a hot fudge sundae when sees Jennifer leading Biff by the hand into the parking l Everyone at the counter is enjoying their dessert, when D lets out a blood curdling scream.

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOOO
dialogues.text: He vaults over the counter making a bee-line for the door Everyone turns and stares as he races toward the entrance EXT. SODA SHOP. Biff's car is just pulling onto the street when David spr into the parking lot. He takes off after the car, sprinti down the street.

dialogues.speaker: DOESN'T EXIST
dialogues.text: The tail lights recede in the distance as David slows to jog and then finally a walk. He pauses, winded, in the street, then looks up toward Heaven with a pissed off loo his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to God)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a beautiful tree-lined pond with a lush willow tree the foreground. The moonlight glistens silver across the water. Several cars are parked in a row with their occupa HOLDING HANDS. Biff's convertible is parked at the end. SHOT. BIFF'S CAR. He sits stiffly at the wheel staring straight ahead. Jenn is draped languidly across the seat beside him, making th most of her mohair sweater. She stares at Biff in a not-s Pleasantville-kind-of-way. He glances over at her and swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure is pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah ... Gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be honest Mary Sue. I didn't think you'd want to come here until we'd been pinned for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Biff. You can "pin" me any time you want to. She leans back a liftle more, draping her arm across the of the seat. Her tits point toward the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe I should just "pin" you. He looks over at her a little confused, then breaks into goony laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's silly Mary Sue. How could you possibly pin me? CLOSE UP. BIFF. He is still guffawing when he looks over at Jennifer and suddenly freezes. Biff's eyes widen ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David comes sprinting up to the porch, then doubles over catching his breath. He clings onto the porch swing when door opens behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud? WIDER. His "mother" and "father" come out onto the porch. David catches his breath then forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Mary Sue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why no. She's still on her date with Biff ... is something the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still panting a little)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I ... I was just ... worried about her. His mother and father exchange a "knowing" look. George r a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (oppressively paternal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, your sister's a little older now and she's naturally going to start going out with boys. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... In fact pretty soon--she's even going to get married and make someone a good little home-maker like your mother here. (smiles at Betty/ inside joke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's IF she can learn to bake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, George ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your sister is a fine young woman and she would never do anything for us to be concerned about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The low gutteral MOANS of two coupling animals drifts out over the evening air. It is raw and primitive and despera The CAMERA begins to TRACK behind all the other cars--the occupants primly holding hands in a tender sillouhette. I finally COMES TO REST on a convertible at the end, with a girl's leg sticking out the window. CLOSER. A Letterman's sweater hangs over the door. The windshield completely fogged. Jennifer's sweater is draped over the backseat. The car is rocking. INT. CAR. They are clenched in a mad embrace: all arms and hair. Bi pulls back for a moment, GASPING for air. His face is cov with lipstick and there is a crazy look in his eye. He's stuck somewhere between passion and fear as he clings desperately to the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (some terror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I better go home now Mary Sue ... She holds onto his shirt as her knee rubs the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more terror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think ... I might be ill ... He glances down at his lap a little confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think something's happening to me. He looks at his crotch then back at Jennifer. She reaches and grabs a handful of his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's s'posed to happen, Biff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me ... He looks at her completely confused as she pulls back dow and OUT OF FRAME ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single light is burning in the kitchen window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want some more cookies? INT. KITCHEN. David is at the kitchen table with a nauseated look on hi face. There are three empty bottles of milk and cookie cr all over the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no ... I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout some Marshmallow Rice Squares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. There is a knock behind them at the door. David springs u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now who could that be. FOLLOWING DAVID. He crosses into the foyer ahead of his "parents." David swings open the door revealing Mr. Johnson, standing on t porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there. You took off so quick. I wasn't sure if you were okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Sorry. I'm fine. I just ... Had to get home early. Mr. Johnson leans in closer and speaks in a CONFIDENTIAL of voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how when we close up, I close the register, then you lower the shades, then I turn out the lights, then we both lock the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you weren't around this time so I did the whole thing myself. CLOSER. Mr. Johnson has a strange look of "manly pride" on his fa His shoulders square back. His chest puffs out a little. There is a sudden sparkle in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more confidential)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only that, I didn't even do it in the same order. First I lowered the shades, then I closed the register. He looks at David with pride then suddenly shifts his gla behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Bill. Neither one says anything but neither one has to. David l on in horror as his mother locks eyes with Mr. Johnson an his new found virility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look, thanks for coming by. I ... really appreciate it. He turns and starts hustling him down the walk just as Bi convertible pulls up at the curb. INT. CAR. CLOSE UP. JENNIFER. She looks sweetly over at the driver's side of the car (O OF FRAME).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well gee thanks Biff. I had a really wonderful time. ANGLE. BIFF. OTHER SIDE OF CAR. He sits behind the wheel with a totally dazed look on his face. Biff stares stunned at Jennifer, like he just got h with a couple of thousand volts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Me too. She leans over and kisses him on the cheek ... Then she b his ear lobe, gently, and flashes him a big smile. Biff smiles back. EXT. CAR. She climbs out and shuts the door. Jennifer nods to Mr. Johnson as she heads up the walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Mr. Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello Mary Sue. She is wearing a big smile by the time she reaches the po David grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. She starts up the staircase. David follows her and the CA follows them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean "nothing?" That's not nothing. That's ... She reaches the top of the stairs and turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax "Bud." We had a really nice time. (mock YAWN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Now I'm really tired and we gotta get up early for school in the morning so ... She flashes her brother an evil grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Night. She shuts the door softly in his face. David stairs at th gray wood in front of him. EXT. ELM STREET. NIGHT. Biff pulls up at an intersection with the same dazed look his eye. The car rumbles at the stoplight for a moment or two, before he glances over to his right. CLOSE UP. BIFF. The stunned look turns to one of sheer amazement: BIFF'S POV. ROSE. There, against a gray picket fence, on a black and white street in a black and white neighborhood, A SINGLE RED RO IS BLOOMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be a stunning vista if it wasn't in black and wh The church steeple gleams in the sunlight. The perfect li houses look like a row of pretty toys ... INT. PARKER LIVING ROOM. DAY. David sits parked in front of the TV furtively turning through the channels. He flips the dial frantically. No s of Dick Van Dyke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud. It's 7:30 in the morning. Are you watching television? He gives her a sheepish grin and sighs ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the same configuration as earlier. Everyone wears t Pleasantville "Lions" jerseys, white sneakers and black socks. David enters the Gym a little groggy. He hasn't ha much sleep. CLOSER. He looks up and stops. David cocks his head to the side, staring across the gym. HIS POV. BIFF AND OTHER BOYS. They are huddled at the far end, each holding a basketbal under his arm. Biff is in the center of the group, animat describing something that is holding their RAPT ATTENTION WIDER ANGLE. INCLUDING DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no ... Biff continues his story while they stare at him with the mouths open. The Coach blows his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on men. Let's go. Big game next week. The huddle breaks up as the basketball players all wander toward the hoop. Ten shots go up at once but NOT ONE COME EVEN CLOSE. Several clang off the rim, a couple hit the e of the backboard. One slams into the side of the gym. Everyone stares in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David stands face to face with his sister in mid conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this, Jennifer. I WARNED you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the big deal. Oh. Okay. They're like not good at basketball anymore. Like--omigod, what a tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. You're messing with their UNIVERSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe it needs to be messed with. Did that ever like--occur to you? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, they don't want to be like this, it's just that nobody ever helped them before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking past)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "MS". How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kewl "PJ". How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relishing her new word)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Kewl." Jennifer smiles at her friend as she goes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no right to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if I don't who will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're happy like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
